events.name: ASConference 2017 - Current and Emerging Trends in Detection & Diagnostics
events.description:
Current and Emerging Trends in Detection & Diagnostics 
Come and find out how cutting-edge solutions from Temasek Polytechnic can help your enterprise or institution bridge networks and accelerate innovation! The conference will feature international speakers who will cover a wide range of topics such as novel detection technologies, instrumentation and integration, biosensors, and future products.
Invited speakers will cover a broad range of topics such as:

Medical diagnosis
Microbiological diagnostics
Genetic diagnostics – precision medicine / cancer detection and diagnostic technologies
Water quality measurement / advances in water quality monitoring
Emerging microbial concerns in food safety, foodborne diseases and detection/diagnostics for food safety
Nanotechnology in diagnostic techniques / nanomolecular diagnostics
Plant disease diagnostics and management
Molecular diagnosis of animal diseases - current trends and perspectives
Recent advances in biomedical / biological molecular imaging
Biosensors and future products
Diagnostic biomarkers of syndromes and disorders
Next Generation Point-of-care Testing (POCT) technologies

Find more information here: http://www.tp.edu.sg/asconference
events.location: Auditorium 1, Temasek Polytechnic, 21 Tampines Avenue 1, Singapore 529757
events.group_name: Temasek Polytechnic School of Applied Science

events.name: AY 17/18 Welcome Event
events.description: We'll be going through the results of our member survey (and its implications), our plan for the upcoming semester and our newly selected committee. There will also be NTUOSS T-shirts and stickers given away during the event so make sure you can make it!

events.name: August Clojure Meetup
events.description: Agenda • 6:30 Food & Drinks• 7:00 Make (Business) Rules Great Again - Ramkumar Kb + Rajeev Shetty• 8:00 Stuart Sierra's Reloaded + Component - Karol Andrusieczko  Slack Channel We have a #clojure-sg slack channel. To join, simply join the Clojurians team: http://clojurians.net/ and then search for the #clojure-sg channel, where you can post questions or share your clojure using experience.
events.location: ThoughtWorks Singapore, 18 Cross Street, #11-08 China Square Central, Singapore 048423

events.name: TensorFlow and Deep Learning: 7th Event : Mobile
events.description: It's time to look at mobile models and how to get some deep learning magic onto your phone.  We have several speakers that will be covering mobile-ready models from the ground up, as well as building models for use in iOS11's new CoreML. As usual, you can expect there will be 2-3 'long format' talks, with a focus on showing how to implement TensorFlow models from both a theoretical and a practical standpoint.   We've put the MeetUp start time at 6:45pm, so that we can start the talks promptly at 7pm. --- As always, we're actively looking for more speakers - both '30 minutes long-form', and lightning talks where we welcome folks to come up and talk about something cool they've done with TensorFlow and/or Deep Learning for 5-10mins (if you have slides, then #max=10). The key for the Lightning Talks slot is simply the cool/interesting factor.  It doesn't matter whether you're an expert or an enthusiastic beginner: Given the responses we have had, we're sure there are lots of people who would be interested to hear what you've been playing with. Please suggest yourself here : https://www.meetup.com/TensorFlow-and-Deep-Learning-Singapore/suggestion/
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, , Singapore

events.name: Welcome .NET Core 2.0, ASP.NET Core 2.0 and .NET Standard 2.0
events.description: Hi all, This is our exciting moment. The .NET Team has released the version 2 of .NET Core and ASP.NET Core, it was announce in this links: Announcing .NET Core 2.0 Announcing ASP.NET Core 2.0 Let's meetup and talk about it. What is new and what has been merge from .NET Framework, the latest road map and demos on how to use .NET Core 2.0 and demo on ASP.NET Core 2.0. How to deploy this in Azure using App Services and Docker and for old school, we will demo on how to deploy this on VM. How to integrate with Visual Studio 2017 v15.3 Preview 7.1. All cool stuff... Please join and you can ask, discuss if your project require for migration to the latest .NET Core and ASP.NET Core 2.0. See you at the venue...
events.location: Level 21, Room MPR-01, Microsoft Singapore, 1 Marina Blvd, Singapore 018989

events.name: DataScience SG X Go-Jek
events.description: In this month's DataScience SG Meetup, we are proud to have data scientists from Go-Jek that will be sharing with us about Data Science in their company! Outline of Talk • Intro to Go-Jek (+ a short video on our social impact) • Drivers ranking model (Zane Lim) • Deployment infrastructure (Zane Lim) • Wide and deep learning for food recommendation (Wang Weimin) • Supply and demand forecasts using LSTM3 (Wang Weimin) • Unsupervised learning for fraud detection (Wang Weimin) Speaker Profile • Zane is a machine learning practitioner and an AI enthusiast. His job involves end-to-end predictive modelling application, from building data pipelines to machine learning modelling to engineering real-time deployment. Off-work, Zane has participated in various data science hackathons. He is an avid Kaggler and a mentor in Udacity’s Artificial Intelligence nanodegree programme. https://www.linkedin.com/in/limzane/ • Weimin Wang has 5 years of experiences in Data Science and Machine Learning and holds a Master’s Degree in Statistics. His current focuses lie in deep learning, with areas of interest such as LSTM for time series forecast, unsupervised fraud detection, recommendation system, image-to-text, sequence-to-sequence and reinforcement learning. • Weimin is keen to create business impact with AI. He is curious to explore state-of-the-art deep learning models, experienced in implementing applications in TensorFlow, and passionate about writing blogs to share his knowledge. https://www.linkedin.com/in/weimin-wang-ab355325/ DataScience SG would like to express our appreciation to NTUC U Future Leaders for venue sponsorship. For more information about U Future Leaders, please visit https://www.ntuc.org.sg/wps/portal/up2/home/membership/progression/ufutureleaders RSVP will open on August 11, 12pm. RSVP will close on August 23, 10pm Please note our attendance policy. https://www.facebook.com/groups/dataScienceSG/permalink/664960927046434/
events.location: NTUC Auditorium, Level 7,  1 Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: Learning To Code With Google's Go - The Future Language of Choice (24th August)
events.description: We will be conducting a free meetup to teach new programmers how to code using Google's Go. At the end of two hours, you will learn to write simple code in Go, compile it, and execute the program. This lesson is targeted at new beginners who have no prior background in coding, although existing programmers in learning Go are welcomed to join in as well. As spaces are limited, priority goes to new programmers. This is a very basic course, we highly recommend it to anyone who's interested to pick up coding even if you have no prior background at all. Go is easily the future language of choice for big companies! See these articles on why you should learn go here and why it's the future. For this lesson, you must bring along your own computer (any system) and be prepared to learn how to write code and build websites! There are no other prerequisites. Don't have a computer? Pm me and I will bring one more for you. Spaces are limited for only 30 students.
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore

events.name: Elm Chat
events.description:
UPDATE: hit the wrong date button on first publish - the date will be this Thursday 



After a good break in July it is time to get back to doing more with Elm! Come to our first Elm Chat, an evening where we will simply meet at a cafe/bar and chat about Elm and Elm'ish things. Bring your questions about Elm and your ideas about what we should be doing in Elm-Singapore. We have also started planning our next Elm Talks which we will schedule for some time in September. You can follow along and contribute on this github issue.  Don't forget that we also have on-going work to create and choose a logo for the group. You can find the existing contributions here to inspire your own creation. The plan is to kick-off a voting process in September, so submit a pull request with your idea already. Looking forward to seeing you at one of our next events. Cheers Mads

events.name: World of Wonders Pop-up Workshops
events.description:
In conjunction with the Singapore Night Festival, we will be holding a series of drop-in workshops* for visitors age 5 and above. Workshop activities involve making your own cloud lamp, assemble your own glowing spectacles to get gooey with concocting your very own glow-in-dark slime.  Come on down to the Prototyping Lab (level 1) at the National Design Centre starting this Thursday to Saturday, evening till late.

*Fee applies to all activities. First-come-first-serve while stock lasts.
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG, 111 Middle Road, #01-02, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969
